results.title: Jane Conquest magic lantern slides
results.brief_description:
Creator, York & Son, England. Woman standing looking out church window.
Narrative for slide “Unable to open the heavy door, Jane climbed through a window, reached the belfry, and grasped the rope, ‘sole cord of hope’.”
results.description:

Narrative for slide “Unable to open the heavy door, Jane climbed through a window, reached the belfry, and grasped the rope, ‘sole cord of hope’.”

results.title: Jane Conquest magic lantern slides
results.brief_description:
Creator, York & Son, England. Woman in snow in front of church.
narrative for slide “…….. and then on the heights by the church where the wintry waste is unnaturally illumined by the burst of scarlet and orange flames in the mountainous seas).”
results.description:

results.title: Jane Conquest magic lantern slides
results.brief_description:
Creator, York & Son, England. Woman in snowy forest.
Narrative for slide: “She fought her way at last through blinding snow to the church on the cliff above the burning vessel (two spectacular slides in which the minute figure of the heroine is seen; first in a vast, hostile, white landscape ……..”
results.description:

results.title: Jane Conquest magic lantern slides
results.brief_description:
Creator, York & Son, England. Angel.
Note: With a biunial lantern projector, LN179801 Jane’s Conquest 6/17 ‘Angel’ was used to show an angel appearing at Jane’s shoulder (LN179800 Jane’s Conquest 5/17 Woman on knees with baby in bassinet and LN179812 Jane’s Conquest 17/17 Husband and Wife with Baby in bassinet. ”
Narrative for slide: see slide 5/17 and 17/17

results.title: Jane Conquest magic lantern slides
results.brief_description:
Creator, York & Son, England. Woman with baby in bassinet.
Note: With a biunial lantern projector, LN179801 Jane’s Conquest 6/17 ‘Angel’ was used to show an angel appearing at Jane’s shoulder.

Narrative for slide “In the next slide she was on her knees praying for strength and inspiration to save the trapped mariners. The strains of ‘Abide with me’ pealed forth from the harmonium and a plump angel appeared by the cot of the dying child. Jane commended the boy to the care of this celestial being, and, rising to her feet, went out into the frozen night.”
